title: No-Code Smart Contracts
description: The power and joy of building Cardano apps is only available to the less than 0.001% of the population familiar with programming

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a great implementation that mesh the cardano blockchain with the non-tech developers needs from any point of view, because I think this implementation will be core for the Cardano community developers that have low experience on Pluts programming and will help great adoptions and allow to growth in the future.
This proposal is well written and clearly demonstrate  the experience and the team's commitment, guarantees solidity in deliverables, support transparency and accountability for all Cardano community.  This is an important proposal to integrate new conceptual smart-contracts devloping and connect them with the real world business industries.
The proposal clearly articulates the contest, the problem (new developer ecosystem to write and test smart contracts) and how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for all of the stakeholders. Well done that the proposers team just worked on iother blockchains (eg. Ethereum).
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer team (Ferdon company ) is very well skilled about the whole context of the proposal, but it's seems that doesn't know the Cardano community very well because they work on other blockchains.
The scope of the solution is very well explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…) and it's convincing.
The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon, also in technical realization. The solutions is well documented and there is a running pilot platform for testing. The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties in adoption processes.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones, but no  KPI metrics are shown. I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them (e.g. difficulties in adoption of the tools/API…) The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and coherent budget with this challenge. I miss in this area that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and market competitors.

f6_assessments.q0:
In their previous funded proposal (https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/No-Code-For-Creative-Africa/351502-48088) a commentator asked the proposer why the proposal was not submitted under Developer Ecosystem challenge. Tim O' Brien's reply was: "Since we target the Citizen Developer with zero technical training I don't see us as part of a Developer Ecosystem". Apparently things have changed rapidly.

The challenge asks: "How can we create a positive developer experience that helps the developer focus on building successful apps?" This proposal essentially allows more people to become "developers", even those who thought they are not tech savvy enough to be developers.

The proposer states: "This project allows developers to develop smart contracts without having to master functional programming, Haskell or have a deep understanding of blockchain or Cardano tools." If that is the case, this is highly valuable addition to Cardano tooling.

In their other proposal (No-Code for Citizen Developers) it is mentioned that QModeler would cost $30 per month per user. Hopefully that doesn't apply to Project Catalyst members.
f6_assessments.q1:
Ferdon is a company with a team of developers ready. However, it's a bit unclear whether these people would be part of the proposed approach and in which magnitude. The proposed team requires more clarity.

The proposal promises:
- Faster time to market
- Lower cost of development
- Lower cost of maintenance.
- Lower total cost of ownership
- Higher reliability
- Higher Agility
- Increased creativity

They say they have worked with various blockchains. Yet the proposal doesn't include even one client reference that would justify these claims.

In a project of this magnitude there should be a trustworthy third-party providing checks and balances. Now we are left wanting more and we are merely expected to trust the proposer to deliver.

The proposer should consider collaboration with No-Code proposer Marian Filipovici (flycode.io) who also got funded in Fund5: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/352756-48088
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget and road map are somewhat self-explanatory. Yet proper goal setting is missing and vague statements like "thousands of new developers" cannot be considered actual goals. Also KPIs are missing.

As a CA I have high integrity and I never copy-paste my assessments. This proposer, rightfully so, has copy-pasted so much that I follow suit. Also, it took hours to go through all proposals, related videos and websites.

My ability to evaluate the proposals:
In my day job I use no-code development approach every day but I haven't used Q-Modeler before. It sounds fantastic but unfortunately I cannot judge the proposal with 100% technical accuracy due to my lack of experience with the technology.

Note to voters:
This team was funded with $20,000 in Fund5 and has now proposed five interesting challenges in Fund6 totaling $200,000+ USD:
https://www.cardanonocode.com/projects.html
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/No-Code-For-Creative-Africa/351502-48088

Equipping the proposals with videos is a really good way to deliver the message (although one of the videos could use some editing).

The proposals would have been better if they had been proofread. It's not "crowed source" but crowd-source. Perhaps it's just me and my OCD with editing but this kind of small things unnecessarily devalue the proposals.

Getting funding for this should be dependent on proof of ability to deliver results, including completion of the Fund5 proposal. Once the team has proven its worth, nothing stops from making this an integral part of Cardano. Heck, why not brand this as CardaNoCode? :)

If you don't get funding, please learn from feedback apply again in Fund6.
f6_assessments.reply:
The CA lacks clear articulation of the rationale for the assessment in a constructive way.  The CA did  not follow the guidelines
- In the impact statement the reviewer quotes an irrelevant  statment I made in a comment in an F5 proposal. The reviewer also expresses his/her wish not to pay 35 for use of the platform. I don't see a justification for the ranking
 
-The CA  did not review the team description on our website provideed several times in our proposal. 
 
-Under feasability ,the CA provides  third party evaluators and also suggests we partner with other proposers without providing any feedback on the feasability of the proposal other then they want others involved.
 
-The CA is not specific just makes general statements:  "Getting funding for this should be dependent on proof of ability to deliver results, including completion of the Fund5 proposal. Once the team has proven its worth, nothing stops from making this an integral part of Cardano. " 
 
- We provide videos of our technology, and deep explinations. Our website, which the CA visited, contains a client list but i think it is unreasonalble to ask for client lists.

f6_assessments.q0:
To begin with: This proposal is very well written and shows that you can communicate even complex topics in an understandable way. Well done!
With the approach to facilitate No-code access to the development of Smart-Contract, this project not only hits the core of this challenge but also lets hope for great impact on the mainstream adoption of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan presented is easy to follow, and although a complex subject is covered, the way the technical details are presented makes it very easy to understand the scope of the project. This should serve as a model for many other projects. Tim has already proven his skills and experience many times (also in the Community) and the presented plan shows that he knows what he is talking about. The budget is explained in detail and in spite of the high amount measured by the potential impact absolutely fair from my perspective. I expect this project to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The objective and timeline are clearly defined. The only thing that can be improved in this proposal is to give the community the possibility to monitor the progress of the project (e.g. Github repository or similar). Also the success could be defined more accurately. E.g. how many users or applications use this solution after a certain time. However, this project offers enough aspects to make auditability possible.

solution: Build a Plutus adapter to our no-code product that allows deploying smart contracts to Cardano.
experience: Ferdon is a team of 20 passionate individuals with 4 years of experience in building a  no-code development platform  for blockchain
